Name: Melanocytic nevi
Symptoms: Pigmented spots on skin; can be raised or flat
Treatments: No treatment required;surgical removal for cosmetic reasons
Information: Melanocytic nevi also known as moles are a type of benign tumor

Name: Melanoma
Symptoms: Asymmetrical moles with irregular borders; dark color
Causes: UV exposure; genetics; weakened immune system
Information: Melanoma is a type of skin cancer that can spread to other parts of the body

Name: Benign keratosis-like lesions
Information: Benign keratosis-like lesions are harmless growths that can resemble skin cancer

Name: Basal cell carcinoma
Symptoms: Raised waxy bump ; flat scaly patch
Causes: UV exposure; genetics; weakened immune system
Information: Basal cell carcinoma is a type of skin cancer that grows slowly and rarely spreads to other parts of the body

Name: Actinic keratoses
Symptoms: Rough scaly patches on skin often on face scalp and hands
Causes: UV exposure; fair skin; weakened immune system
Information: Actinic keratoses are precancerous growths that can turn into squamous cell carcinoma if left untreated

Name: Dermatofibroma
Symptoms: Small firm bump on skin often on legs
Treatments: No treatment required; surgical removal for cosmetic reasons
Information: Dermatofibroma is a benign tumor that can be mistaken for skin cancer

Name: Vascular lesions
Symptoms: Red or purple patches on skin often on face and neck
Information: Vascular lesions are abnormal clusters of blood vessels that can be congenital or acquired

Name: Acne and Rosacea Photos
Information: Acne and Rosacea are common skin conditions that can be treated with medications and lifestyle changes

Name: Eczema Photos
Symptoms: Red itchy scaly patches on skin
Information: Eczema is a chronic skin condition that can be managed with medications and lifestyle changes

Name: Healthy
Information: Daily Hygeine to maintain your health
